Posts.Content: Evening Dizzy17 I hope the queasy tummy has passed. I got some travel bands to wear. they seem to have helped settle my tummy.  Be kind to yourself Julie x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Evening Dizzy 17 I had to use the senna they prescribed - which thankfully worked. My appetite came back quickly after the initial nausea.  Julie x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi shiney  could your doctor not write a sick note to recommend readjustment to your working day? Julie x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: hi I have had a much better day so am hoping it was just the initial affects.  Julie x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Beds I have had one cycle so far and used the cold cap. it was a really hot day so having the cap was great. I have my second treatment next week so I will see how my hair fairs then. Julie x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: hi , yes sickness has passed. it really is a rollercoaster this treatment!! I have gone from feeling well and active to needing lots of naps HOpe everyone else is doing well Julie .
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi supermom  I brought the travel bands from Morrison's, they were £7. They have worked for me so far..... on the box it mentions for use for chemotherapy patients. Julie x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Dizzy  hOpe you find the travel bands.  I also found washing my teeth made the sickness worse in the morning so trying to do that a bit later. I have a craving for lemonade and cream soda which has helped... lol Julie x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Good morning Ali Owl up, dogs walked and preparing for my 2nd chemotherapy treatment later today. Big hugs to all you other chemo buddies who will be joining me today  Julie x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Liz hOpe the PICC line works for you. I had the picc line fitted and it did make the actual process much simpler. I had my 1st cycle yesterday afternoon and so far I have been sick 4 times through the night, so am hoping it will stop now and I can move on. jsending hugs & positivity  Julie x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Thank you Frankie was sick just the once last night which was an improvement.  slept well the rest of the night . juliex
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****
